intro: Isopyrum stoloniferum, commonly known as the creeping sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in dry environments. Isopyrum stoloniferum is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in open, sunny habitats.
